analysis.title: Dracula Untold
analysis.author: Matt Sazama & Burk Sharpless
analysis.logline: A Transylvanian prince makes a dark supernatural bargain to save his kingdom from Ottoman invasion, transforming into a vampire to protect his family and people.

concept.justification: Fresh vampire origin story blending historical context with supernatural mythology, offering compelling reimagining of Dracula's genesis

structure.justification: Clear three-act structure with progressive complications, strong narrative momentum, minor pacing issues in middle act

protagonist.justification: Vlad has clear motivations, active agency, compelling character arc from principled leader to tragic supernatural protector

supporting_cast.justification: Memorable characters like Mirena, Cazan, and Mehmed with distinct voices and narrative purposes

dialogue.justification: Strong period-appropriate dialogue with subtext, characters distinguish themselves through speech

genre_execution.justification: Masterful blend of historical drama, supernatural horror, and action set pieces

originality.justification: Unique vampire origin narrative, reimagines Dracula mythology with historical grounding

cast_attachability.note: Lead role attractive to action stars

comparable_success.note: Similar to successful supernatural action films

structure_analysis.act_breaks: Act 1: Pre-transformation setup, Act 2: Supernatural bargain/initial conflict, Act 3: Final battle

characters.protagonist: Vlad Dracula - Principled prince willing to sacrifice everything for family and kingdom
characters.antagonist: Mehmed - Ottoman Sultan seeking territorial expansion
supporting: Mirena - Supportive wife with strong moral center
Cazan - Loyal advisor with complex relationship to Vlad
Ingeras - Vlad's son, narrative and emotional anchor

standout_scenes.scene: Vlad's transformation sequence at Broken-Tooth Mountain

standout_scenes.why: Epic supernatural action with high emotional stakes

budget_tier.justification: Requires significant VFX and period production design

strengths: Strong emotional core of family protection
weaknesses: Complex mythology might challenge casual viewers
development_notes: Potentially expand worldbuilding for franchise potential
assessment.recommendation_rationale: Strong weighted score of 7.55, zero critical failures, high commercial viability score of 15, and compelling genre execution make this a promising supernatural action project.

analysis.verdict_statement: Based on its fresh supernatural reimagining and strong narrative execution, this screenplay demonstrates commercial viability and craft that warrant immediate development consideration. Luke Evans presents a strong casting opportunity for the lead role of Vlad Dracula.
